content: quote: The Democratic leader in the Senate promised Sen. Arlen Specter he would retain his seniority when he jumped from the Republican to the Democratic Party, Specter said on Wednesday, but faced "pushback" from other Democratic senators. Sen. Arlen Specter says Pennsylvania "has a big interest" in his seniority. The full Senate voted Tuesday to strip Specter of his seniority, dropping him to the bottom of the pile on every committee he sits on. The Senate action came on a resolution -- passed on a unanimous voice vote -- that set out committee assignments for the entire Senate. The saying "rank has its privileges" holds true in the U.S. Senate as in few other places. With seniority comes the ability to influence legislation. Specter has been citing his seniority on the powerful Appropriations Committee, the one that doles out money, as he hits the campaign trail as a Democrat. "My senior position on appropriations has enabled me to bring a lot of jobs and a lot of federal funding to this state," Specter said at a town hall meeting on Monday. He repeatedly made a point of telling an auditorium filled with medical faculty and staff about the hundreds of millions of dollars he delivered to Pennsylvania, thanks to the power he's accumulated in his 29 years in the Senate. +http://www.cnn.com/2009/POLITICS/05/06/specter.seniority/index.html If he can no longer deliver the goods who knows what the voters will do.

content: quote: The Democratic leader in the Senate promised Sen. Arlen Specter he would retain his seniority when he jumped from the Republican to the Democratic Party, Specter said on Wednesday, but faced "pushback" from other Democratic senators. Sen. Arlen Specter says Pennsylvania "has a big interest" in his seniority. The full Senate voted Tuesday to strip Specter of his seniority, dropping him to the bottom of the pile on every committee he sits on. The Senate action came on a resolution -- passed on a unanimous voice vote -- that set out committee assignments for the entire Senate. The saying "rank has its privileges" holds true in the U.S. Senate as in few other places. With seniority comes the ability to influence legislation. Specter has been citing his seniority on the powerful Appropriations Committee, the one that doles out money, as he hits the campaign trail as a Democrat. "My senior position on appropriations has enabled me to bring a lot of jobs and a lot of federal funding to this state," Specter said at a town hall meeting on Monday. content: quote: Originally posted by sgt_posty: quote: The Democratic leader in the Senate promised Sen. Arlen Specter he would retain his seniority when he jumped from the Republican to the Democratic Party, Specter said on Wednesday, but faced "pushback" from other Democratic senators. Sen. Arlen Specter says Pennsylvania "has a big interest" in his seniority. The full Senate voted Tuesday to strip Specter of his seniority, dropping him to the bottom of the pile on every committee he sits on. The Senate action came on a resolution -- passed on a unanimous voice vote -- that set out committee assignments for the entire Senate. The saying "rank has its privileges" holds true in the U.S. Senate as in few other places. With seniority comes the ability to influence legislation. Specter has been citing his seniority on the powerful Appropriations Committee, the one that doles out money, as he hits the campaign trail as a Democrat. "My senior position on appropriations has enabled me to bring a lot of jobs and a lot of federal funding to this state," Specter said at a town hall meeting on Monday. He repeatedly made a point of telling an auditorium filled with medical faculty and staff about the hundreds of millions of dollars he delivered to Pennsylvania, thanks to the power he's accumulated in his 29 years in the Senate. +http://www.cnn.com/2009/POLITICS/05/06/specter.seniority/index.html If he can no longer deliver the goods who knows what the voters will do. As long as the Repub party puts up someone like Mr. Toomey Mr. Specter will do well, even without seniority, because MOST of the people that voted for him were moderate Repubs, moderate Demos and Indpendents and these will not vote for Mr. Toomey. IF the Pa Repubs select Mr Ridge (a moderate Repub with a record similar to Mr. Specter's) THEN his losing the seniority might hurt him. This message has been edited.
